snippet: The continuing sluggishness underscores that the recovery will not happen on its own.
abstract: Editorial disputes assertions by politicians and lawmakers that winter weather negatively impacted economy; cites employment report showing that weather did not affect employment as much as believed and that springtime recovery was less significant than anticipated; calls on Federal Reserve to craft policies to help ailing economy and to be wary of those who blame economic troubles on weather.
lead_paragraph: The continuing sluggishness underscores that the recovery will not happen on its own.

headline.main: No Spring Thaw in the Job Market
headline.print_headline: No Spring Thaw in the Job Market
